info.description:
Applications V1 is deprecated

This version of the API has been deprecated. Please use version 2 going forwards
A Nexmo application contains the security and configuration information you need to connect to Nexmo endpoints and easily use our products.
info.title: Nexmo Application API

parameters.description: You can find your API key in your [account overview](https://dashboard.nexmo.com/account-overview)
parameters.name: api_key

parameters.description: You can find your API secret in your [account overview](https://dashboard.nexmo.com/account-overview)
parameters.name: api_secret

parameters.description: Set the number of items returned on each call to this endpoint. The default is 10 records.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Set the offset from the first page. The default value is `0`.
parameters.name: page_index

get.description: You use a `GET` request to retrieve details of all applications associated with your account.

answer_method.description: The HTTP method used to make the request to `answer_url`. The default value is `GET`.

answer_url.description: The URL where your webhook delivers the Nexmo Call Control Object that governs this call. As soon as your user answers a call Nexmo makes a request to `answer_url`. Required for inbound calls only.

event_method.description: The HTTP method used to send event information to `event_url`. The default value is `POST`. For `voice` type applications only.

event_url.description: Nexmo sends event information asynchronously to this URL when status changes for `voice` applications. Always required for `voice` applications.

inbound_method.description: The HTTP method used to send event information to `inbound_url`. The default value is `POST`. For `messages` type applications only.

inbound_url.description: Nexmo sends a request to this URL when an inbound message is received. Required for `messages` type applications only.

status_method.description: The HTTP method used to send event information to `status_url`. The default value is `POST`. For `messages` type applications only.

status_url.description: Nexmo sends event information asynchronously to this URL when status changes. Required for `messages` type applications only.

type.description: The Nexmo product or products that you access with this application. Currently `voice` and `messages` application types are supported.

post.description: You use a `POST` request to create a new application.

parameters.description: The ID allocated to your application by Nexmo.
parameters.name: app_id

delete.description: You use a `DELETE` request to delete a single application.

get.description: You use a `GET` request to retrieve details about a single application.

parameters.description: The ID allocated to your application by Nexmo.
parameters.name: app_id

answer_method.description: The HTTP method used to make the request to `answer_url`. The default value is `GET`.

answer_url.description: The URL where your webhook delivers the Nexmo Call Control Object that governs this call. As soon as your user answers a call Nexmo makes a request to `answer_url`.

event_method.description: The HTTP method used to send event information to `event_url`. The default value is POST.

event_url.description: Nexmo sends event information asynchronously to this URL when status changes.

type.description: The Nexmo product or products that you access with this application. Currently `voice` and `messages` application types are supported. You  can't change the type of application.

put.description: You use a `PUT` request to update an existing application.

apiKey.description: You can find your API key in your [account overview](https://dashboard.nexmo.com/account-overview)

apiSecret.description: You can find your API secret in your [account overview](https://dashboard.nexmo.com/account-overview)

id.description: The ID allocated to your application by Nexmo.

applications.description: The collection of your applications. Each object contains information about an an individual application. The public_key is not included in the application information.

count.description: The number of items associated with your account.

page_index.description: The offset from the first page.

page_size.description: The number of items returned on each call to this endpoint. The default is 10 records.

keys.description: The Nexmo product that you access with this application.

public_key.description: The public key used to validate the [JWT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON_Web_Token).

private_key.description: The private key you use to generate the JSON Web Token (JWT) that authenticates your requests to Messages API.

links.description: A series of links between resources in this API in the following [HAL specification](http://stateless.co/hal_specification.html).

messages.description: The Nexmo product that you access with this application.

endpoint.description: `inbound_url`: The URL where inbound messages are delivered. `status_url`: The URL where message status is delivered.

http_method.description: The HTTP method used to send data to the `inbound_url` or `status_url`. Default is POST.

voice.description: The Nexmo product that you access with this application.

endpoint.description: `answer_url`: The URL where your webhook delivers the Nexmo Call Control Object that governs this call. As soon as your user answers a call Nexmo makes a request to answer_url. `event_url`: Nexmo sends event information asynchronously to this URL when status changes.

http_method.description: The HTTP method used to send event information to the `event_url` or `answer_url`.
